page.title: 17TOURISM IN MINCHINHAMPTON
page.content: 1.{Common}- Kite flying, cattle running free, golf for fun, horse riding, large open space and views. 2.{Architecture}- Cotswold stone buildings in and around Minchinhampton. 3.{Archaeology}- Bulwalks, Iron Age fortifications, Pillow Mounds (people breed rabbits in them and put ferrets in to kill them). 4.{Centre for visiting}- Slimbridge, Stroud and valleys, Avening, Nailsworth, Cotswolds, Bristol (theatre, shopping and historic buildings), and Bath (theatre and historic buildings). 5.{Gliding}- Hampton Fields. 6.{Ballooning}-from Bristol
